comment.author: 43031983@N07
comment._content: This point is I think now part of garden island and if I am right that is where th house called "Crecy" another called "Agincourt" were. If so I have some photos of the gardens down to the water of "Crecy" taken circa 1914/15/16.

comment.author: 29001384@N00
comment._content:
Hi Junebubba, i have been trying to research what properties were present prior to the Govt taking the land from 2 to 6 wylde st potts point from private residence's for the Navy. I have worked on and off at 6 wylde st for the past 12 yrs and i only have a little bit of information about the area.I would appreciate it if you had any info or pics to pass on.
I know there was Crecy, Agincourt and Kismet, the top floors of Agincourt were demolished to make officer accommodation on the left over foundations. 

Cheers

comment.author: 61804295@N00
comment._content: Hi sydney_dave,, I too have an interest in Garden Is and Wylde St Potts Point. www.flickr.com/photos/spelio/4296998943/ I was wondering if that is "Wyldefel" in the middle distance behind the large pine!
